name: Caf√© de Olla (Mexican Coffee)
description: A twist on a traditional Mexican hot drink, "de olla" refers to the clay pot in which the hot chocolate is made.
preparation: Measure coffee grounds, sugar, Cinnamon, cloves, orange peel and dark Belgian chocolate into insulated French coffee press.
Pour in boiling water. Stir with a long-handled spoon.
Place cover on top of pot. Do not plunge.
Allow to steep for 5 minutes before gently and steadily depressing plunger. There will be slight resistance.
Pour into heated mugs and serve immediately.
